Siapa saudara perempuan Abu Bakar al-Baghdadi yang ditangkap tentara Turki?
05 Nov 2019, 15:42 by BBC


Pejabat Turki mengeluarkan foto perempuan yang ditangkap dalam operasi.

Saudara perempuan mantan pemimpin kelompok yang menamakan diri Negara Islam (ISIS) Abu Bakar al-Baghdadi ditangkap di Suriah bagian utara, kata sejumlah pejabat Turki.
Rasmiya Awad, 65 tahun, ditangkap dalam sebuah penggerebekan pada hari Senin (04/11) di dekat kota Azaz, kata pejabat.
Pejabat Turki yang dikutip sejumlah media meyakini lewat penangkapan itu akan didapat data intelijen yang berguna terkait ISIS.
Baghdadi membunuh dirinya dalam operasi yang dilakukan pasukan khusus AS terhadap kompleksnya di Suriah barat laut bulan lalu.


Apa yang akan terjadi pada ISIS sesudah kematian Abu Bakar al-Baghdadi?


Nadia Murad, eks budak seks ISIS: 'Tidak cukup hanya Baghdadi, kami ingin keadilan ditegakkan'


Pemimpin ISIS: AS merilis video pertama serangan di lokasi persembunyian Abu Bakar al-Baghdadi sebelum penyerbuan


Meninggalnya Baghdadi dipandang sebagai kemenangan bagi Presiden Amerika Serikat Donald Trump, tetapi para pengamat mengatakan ISIS tetap merupakan ancaman keamanan di Suriah dan tempat lainnya.
Seorang pejabat Turki mengatakan kepada kantor berita Reuters penangkapan kakak perempuan Baghdadi dapat membantu menjelaskan "cara kerja di dalam" ISIS.



Direktur komunikasi Presiden Turki Recep Tayyip Erdogan, Fahrettin Altun, mengatakan penangkapan tersebut merupakan "contoh berikutnya dari keberhasilan operasi kontraterorisme".

https://twitter.com/fahrettinaltun/status/1191490871759458304

Tidak banyak yang diketahui terkait saudara Baghdadi dan BBC belum dapat memverifikasi secara independen jati diri perempuan yang ditangkap.
Baghdadi memiliki sejumlah saudara perempuan dan pria, meskipun tidak jelas apakah mereka masih hidup, kata surat kabar The New York Times.


Foto udara tempat yang ditembaki helikopter operasi AS.

Penangkapan dilaporkan dilalukan di Provinsi Aleppo yang sekarang dikuasai Turki.
Awad ditemukan di sebuah karavan, di mana dia tinggal dengan suami, menantu perempuan dan lima anak, kata seorang pejabat Turki kepada AP, sambil menambahkan dia diinterogasi karena diduga terlibat kelompok ekstrem.
Para pejabat mengatakan Awad dapat menjadi "tambang emas" intelijen.
Para pengamat mengatakan kota dimana Awad ditangkap dikenal sebagai jalur penyelundupan keluarga ISIS.
Tetapi belum jelas seberapa berguna intelijen yang dapat diberikan Awad, atau berapa lama dia hidup dengan Baghdadi.


Pemimpin ISIS: Jenazah Abu Bakar al-Baghdadi dibuang, kata militer AS


Abu Bakar al-Baghdadi: Celana dalam pimpinan ISIS 'dicuri' Kurdi agar dapat dilakukan tes DNA


Pemimpin ISIS: Jalannya operasi penyerbuan Abu Bakar al-Baghdadi 'pada malam berbahaya' berlangsung sekitar dua jam


Apa yang diungkapkan
Menurut Mina al-Lami, pengamat media jihadis BBC Monitoring, masih belum diketahui kegunaan intelijen dari saudara Baghdadi, mengingat dia tidak menerima informasi kelompok inti ISIS,
Tetapi dia kemungkinan dapat memberikan informasi tentang jalur penyelundupan dan tempat persembunyian sejumlah anggota ISIS dan keluarganya, karena dia dan keluarganya berada di daerah yang tidak bersahabat terhadap ISIS, Azaz, di Suriah bagian utara.
Kerabat Baghdadi lainnya -- ipar dan kurir pribadinya, Muhammad Ali Sajit -- mengatakan dalam sebuah wawancara bahwa dirinya memberikan informasi kepada pihak berwenang terkait kemungkinan keberadaan Baghdadi di Idlib, di mana pimpinan ISIS tersebut akhirnya meninggal.
Informasi yang diberikannya juga kemungkinan digunakan untuk mengidentifikasi tokoh senior ISIS, terutama pepimpin baru ISIS, Abu Ibrahim al-Hashemi al-Qurashi.
Sampai sejauh ini, pendukung ISIS belum mengomentari penangkapan saudara perempuan Baghdadi.


Pemimpin ISIS Abu Bakar al-Baghdadi tewas dalam operasi militer AS, 'merintih, menangis' sebelum ledakkan bom rompi, kata Presiden Trump


ISIS umumkan nama pemimpin barunya: Abu Ibrahim al-Hashemi


Pemimpin ISIS disebut tewas: 'Pemerintah Indonesia waspadai bangkitnya sel teroris dan keterlibatan perempuan dalam jaringan terorisme'



Seperti apa 
hari-hari terakhir Baghdadi?

Menurut rekan-rekannya, Baghdadi berusaha mengamankan diri di "wilayah kekuasaan ISIS" yang semakin kecil di Suriah bagian timur, lapor kantor berita AP.
Selama berbulan-bulan, dia menjadikan seorang remaja Yazidi sebagai budak seks, membawanya bersama-sama saat melakukan perjalanan dengan kelompok inti sejumlah tujuh orang.
Mereka pindah ke Dashisha, kota perbatasan Suriah yang dikuasai ISIS.
Remaja tersebut tinggal selama empat bulan di rumah mertua Baghdadi, di mana dia sering mengunjunginya dan memperkosanya, kata remaja itu kepada AP.
Dia hanya bergerak pada malam hari, mengenakan pakaian olah raga dan menutupi wajahnya, serta selalu ditemani sekitar lima pengawal, katanya.
Pada periode itu, dia "benar-benar gelisah", takut dikhianati dan disusupi, kata Mohamad Ali Sajit kepada TV al-Arabiya minggu lalu.
Dia kadang-kadang memakai baju penggembala, berjalan-jalan dengan memakai ikat pinggang bunuh diri, bahkan tidur di sebelahnya dan membuat pembantunya juga memakainya; dia tidak pernah memakai telepon genggam, tetapi pembantu dekatnya memilikinya, kata Sajit.
Stres memperburuk penyakit diabetes Baghdadi, sehingga dia selalu berusaha memeriksa gula darah dan menyuntikkan insulin.
Pada akhirnya dia sama sekali meninggalkan wilayah ISIS, memasuki Provinsi Idlib di barat laut, yang dikuasai Hayat Tahrir al-Sham, kelompok militan terkait al-Qaida dan pesaing ISIS.
Dia memilih daerah tersebut karena ini adalah wilayah terakhir di luar kekuasaan pemerintah Suriah, kata para pejabat AS.

Who is Abu Bakar al-Baghdadi's sister captured by the Turkish army?
05 Nov 2019, 15:42 by BBC


Turkish officials released photos of women arrested during the operation.

The sister of the former leader of the group calling itself the Islamic State (ISIS) Abu Bakar al-Baghdadi was arrested in northern Syria, Turkish officials said.
Rasmiya Awad, 65, was arrested in a raid on Monday (04/11) near the city of Azaz, officials said.
Turkish officials quoted by a number of media believe through the capture that useful intelligence related to ISIS will be obtained.
Baghdadi killed himself in an operation carried out by US special forces against his compound in northwest Syria last month.


What will happen to ISIS after the death of Abu Bakar al-Baghdadi?


Nadia Murad, former ISIS sex slave: 'It's not enough just Baghdadi, we want justice to be upheld'


ISIS leader: The US released the first video of the attack on the hideout of Abu Bakar al-Baghdadi before the attack


Baghdadi's death was seen as a victory for US President Donald Trump, but observers said ISIS remained a security threat in Syria and elsewhere.
A Turkish official told Reuters news agency that the arrest of Baghdadi's older sister could help explain "how to work inside" ISIS.



Communications director of Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, Fahrettin Altun, said the arrest was "the next example of a successful counterterrorism operation".

https://twitter.com/fahrettinaltun/status/1191490871759458304

Little is known about Baghdadi's relatives and the BBC has not been able to independently verify the identity of the woman arrested.
Baghdadi has a number of sisters and brothers, although it is unclear whether they are still alive, said the New York Times newspaper.


An aerial photo of the place where the US operation helicopter fired at.

The arrest was reportedly carried out in the province of Aleppo which is now controlled by Turkey.
Awad was found in a caravan, where he lives with her husband, daughter-in-law and five children, a Turkish official told AP, adding he was interrogated for alleged involvement in extremist groups.
Officials say Awad can be a "goldmine" of intelligence.
Analysts say the city where Awad was captured is known as the ISIS family smuggling route.
But it is unclear how useful intelligence can be given Awad, or how long he lived with Baghdadi.


ISIS leader: Abu Bakar al-Baghdadi's body was dumped, the US military said


Abu Bakar al-Baghdadi: ISIS leader's underwear was 'stolen' by Kurds so DNA testing could be carried out


ISIS leader: The course of the Abu Bakar al-Baghdadi raid operation 'on a dangerous night' lasted around two hours


What was revealed
According to Mina al-Lami, an observer of BBC Monitoring jihadis, it is still unknown the use of intelligence from Brother Baghdadi, given that he did not receive information from the core group of ISIS,
But he may be able to provide information about the smuggling paths and hiding places of a number of ISIS members and their families, because he and his family are in an area that is not friendly to ISIS, Azaz, in northern Syria.
Another of Baghdadi's relatives - his brother-in-law and personal courier, Muhammad Ali Sajit - said in an interview that he was giving information to authorities about the possible presence of Baghdadi on Idlib, where the ISIS leader finally died.
The information he provided was also likely to be used to identify senior ISIS figures, especially the new ISIS leader, Abu Ibrahim al-Hashemi al-Qurashi.
So far, ISIS supporters have not commented on the arrest of Baghdadi's sister.


ISIS leader Abu Bakar al-Baghdadi was killed in a US military operation, "whimpering, crying" before blowing up a vest bomb, President Trump said


ISIS announces the name of its new leader: Abu Ibrahim al-Hashemi


ISIS leader called dead: 'Indonesian government beware of rising terrorist cells and women's involvement in terrorism networks'



Like what
Baghdadi's last days?

According to his colleagues, Baghdadi was trying to secure himself in the increasingly smaller "ISIS territory" in eastern Syria, AP news agency reported.
For months, he made a teenage Yazidi a sex slave, bringing it together while traveling with a core group of seven people.
They moved to Dashisha, the Syrian border town controlled by ISIS.
The teenager lived for four months at the house of Baghdadi's parents-in-law, where he often visited and raped her, the teenager told AP.
He only moves at night, wears sport clothes and covers his face, and is always accompanied by about five bodyguards, he said.
In that period, he was "really nervous", afraid of being betrayed and infiltrated, Mohamad Ali Sajit told al-Arabiya TV last week.
He sometimes wears a shepherd's clothes, walks around with a suicide belt, even sleeps next to him and makes his servants wear it; he never used a cell phone, but his close aide had it, Sajit said.
Stress worsens Baghdadi's diabetes, so he always tries to check blood sugar and inject insulin.
In the end he completely left ISIS territory, entering the northwestern Idlib Province, which was controlled by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham, a militant group linked to al-Qaida and ISIS competitors.
He chose the area because this was the last area outside the Syrian government's control, US officials said.
